text: Nasrin Oryakhil (born 1964) is a gynecologist and obstetrician from Afghanistan. She received a 2014 International Women of Courage Award. == Work == In 2004, Oryakhil became the Director of the Malalai Maternity Hospital in Kabul, Afghanistan. At that hospital, she started the first clinic for obstetric fistula repair in Afghanistan. She is the president of the NGO Afghan Family Health Association, and a member of the Afghan Women's Network. Oryakhil is also part of a group to create a Medical Council in Afghanistan. She supported the creation of the Afghan Midwives Association. Oryakhil is a member of the Afghan Womenâ€™s Network. She speaks to the Parliament and at professional medical conferences. She is part of a working group to start a Medical Council in Afghanistan. == Awards == In 2014, Oryakhil received an International Women of Courage Award. ==Related pages== *List of women scientists from Asia == References == == Other websites == * 2015 International Women of Courage Awards, U.S. State Department photostream on Flickr * Secretary's International Women of Courage Award (U.S. Department of State) Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:Afghan scientists Category:Obstetricians Category:Women who received the International Women of Courage Award Category:Gynecologists Category:21st-century Afghan people
title: Nasrin Oryakhil
